question: Which bonds hold together the two complementary polynucleotide chains of DNA?[MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which bonds hold together the two complementary polynucleotide chains of DNA?[MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Hydrogen bonds hold together the two complementary polynucleotide chains of DNA.

question: The Repeating unit of glycogen is
question_latex: The Repeating unit of glycogen is
solution: Starch, glycogen, cellulose, chitin, etc. are homogylcans (glucans) containing only glucose units. Homoglycans are the polysaccharides having only one type of monosaccharide units in them.

question: A mathematical explanation for enzyme action on substrate was formulated by
question_latex: A mathematical explanation for enzyme action on substrate was formulated by
solution: Michaelis and Menten in 1913 gave a mathematical expression to an enzyme catalyzed reaction. The equation is commonly called the Michaelis equation.

question: Given below are two statements: Statement-I : The prosthetic group is firmly bound to the protein component of enzyme by chemical bond Statement-II : Prosthetic group can be removed from protein part of enzyme by hydrolysis. In the light of above statements, select the correct option given below:[MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Given below are two statements: Statement-I : The prosthetic group is firmly bound to the protein component of enzyme by chemical bond Statement-II : Prosthetic group can be removed from protein part of enzyme by hydrolysis. In the light of above statements, select the correct option given below:[MHT-CET 2024]
options: Both statement I and statement II are correct.
Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
answer: Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
solution: The prosthetic group is firmly bound to the protein component by chemical bonds and is not removed by hydrolysis.

question: Which of the following statements are correct for polysaccharides? I. The polysaccharides are found as a part of the acid insoluble pellet II. These are long chains of sugars III. They are threads containing different monosaccharides as building blocks IV. Cellulose is a polymeric polysaccharide consisting of only one type of monosaccharide i.e ., fructose
question_latex: Which of the following statements are correct for polysaccharides? I. The polysaccharides are found as a part of the acid insoluble pellet II. These are long chains of sugars III. They are threads containing different monosaccharides as building blocks IV. Cellulose is a polymeric polysaccharide consisting of only one type of monosaccharide i.e ., fructose
solution: Cellulose is a polymeric polysaccharide consisting of only one type of monosaccharide, i.e., glucose

question: Double sugar is
question_latex: Double sugar is
solution: All of the above. Double sugar is sucrose (table sugar) and milk sugar is lactose. Sugar in germinating seeds is also an example of double sugar

question: The most important form of energy currency in living organisms is the bond energy in the chemical called ..
question_latex: The most important form of energy currency in living organisms is the bond energy in the chemical called..
solution: The most important form of energy currency in living organism is the bond energy in the chemical called ATP

question: Allosteric modulation is due to inhibition action of enzyme by
question_latex: Allosteric modulation is due to inhibition action of enzyme by
solution: Enzyme inhibition caused by a product of enzyme catalyzed reaction is allosteric modulation or feedback inhibition. Thus, products of reaction inhibits the enzyme action, \textit{e.g.}, glucose-6-phosphate, the end product in glycolysis, can inhibit hexokinase activity.

options: A - I, B - III, C - IV,D - II
A - III, B - II, C - I, D - IV
A - III, B - IV, C - I, D - II
A - III, B B I, C - II, D - IV
answer: A - III, B - IV, C - I, D - II

question: Cellulosic cell wall in plants is much tougher than cell membrane due to . in cellulose. A. arrangement of glucose units in polymer chain B. hydrogen bonding between neighbouring chains Choose the correct option.[2022]

both A and B are correct.
both A and B are incorrect.

question: Silk consists of
question_latex: Silk consists of
options: A fine mixture of fibroin and sericin
solution: The central core of silk fibre is made up of fibroin protein. Silk fibres are soft and flexible. These are composed of $ \beta $ -pleated sheets.

question: The lock and key model of enzyme action illustrates that a particular enzyme molecule
question_latex: The lock and key model of enzyme action illustrates that a particular enzyme molecule
options: May be destroyed and resynthesised several times
Interacts with a specific type of substrate molecule
Reacts at identical rates under all conditions
answer: Interacts with a specific type of substrate molecule
solution: Emil Fisher (1894) proposed lock and key theory for the mechanism of enzyme action, according to which the active sites of enzyme have a specific geometric shape wherein the substrate molecules fit in just like a key in a particular lock. In other words, it illustrates that a particular enzyme molecule interacts with a specific type of substrate molecule.

question: Grinding of a living tissue in trichloroacetic acid shows the presence of inorganic compounds like sulphate, phosphate etc, which are categorised in
question_latex: Grinding of a living tissue in trichloroacetic acid shows the presence of inorganic compounds like sulphate, phosphate etc, which are categorised in
solution: The inorganic compounds like sulphate, phosphate etc., are categorised in acid soluble pool

question_latex: Most important fuel of living cells is ___ \text{[MHT-CET 2024]}
solution: Glucose is instant Source of energy as it is primary cellular respiratory substrate.

question: Given below are the two statements. Statement-I : Starch exists in two forms i.e. amylose and amylopectin Statement-II : Amylose is branched polymer of $ \alpha $ -glucose while amylopectin is an unbranched polymer of $ \alpha $-glucose. In the light of above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.[MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Given below are the two statements. Statement-I : Starch exists in two forms i.e. amylose and amylopectin Statement-II : Amylose is branched polymer of \alpha -glucose while amylopectin is an unbranched polymer of \alpha -glucose. In the light of above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.[MHT-CET 2024]
options: Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
Both statement I and statement II are correct.
Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
answer: Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
solution: Amylose is an unbranched polymer of $ \alpha $ glucose. Amylopectin is a branched polymer of $ \alpha $ glucose.

question: Which of the following biomolecules have phosphodiester bonds?[MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following biomolecules have phosphodiester bonds?[MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Nucleotides in nucleic acid are linked with phosphodiester bonds.

question: Choose the correct statement
question_latex: Choose the correct statement
options: The living state is a non-equilibrium steady state to be able to perform work
The constant flow of material for energy in and out of cell prevent the cell from reaching equilibrium
Living state and metabolism are synonyms
solution: All statement are correct

question: Michaelis-Menten constant is ___ [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Michaelis-Menten constant is ___ \text{[MHT-CET 2024]}
options: The conformational change in the enzyme
The point at which final form and shape of the enzyme is determined
The effect of pH on enzyme action
The amount of substrate concentration to produce half of the maximum velocity of enzyme action
answer: The amount of substrate concentration to produce half of the maximum velocity of enzyme action
solution: Km or the Michaelis-Menten constant is defined as the substrate concentration (expressed in moles/lit) to produce half of maximum velocity in an enzyme catalyzed reaction.

question: Fats are esters of ___ [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Fats are esters of ___ \text{[MHT-CET 2023]}
options: Glycerol linked to 3 fatty acids by ester bond.
Phenols linked to 3 fatty acids by ester bond.
Methanol linked to 3 fatty acids by ester bond.
Ethanol linked to 3 fatty acids by ester bond.
answer: Glycerol linked to 3 fatty acids by ester bond.
solution: Fats are esters of glycerol linked to 3 fatty acids by ester bond forming triglycerides, most common type.

question: The simple polyhydroxy ketone molecule containing 3-7 carbons is a
question_latex: The simple polyhydroxy ketone molecule containing 3-7 carbons is a
solution: Monosaccharides are simple sugars with empirical formula $ C_n (H_2O)_n $, and containing 3-7 carbon, \textit{ i.e. }, trioses (3C), tetroses (4C), pentoses (5C) and hexoses (6C).

question: A complex organic nitrogenous compound found in both plant and animal cells is ______[MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: A complex organic nitrogenous compound found in both plant and animal cells is \______\text{[MHT-CET 2023]}
solution: A complex organic nitrogenous compound found in both plant and animal cells is protein.

question: Which one of the following holds the two monosaccharide units together in a disaccharide?[MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Which one of the following holds the two monosaccharide units together in a disaccharide?[MHT-CET 2021]
options: Glycosidic bond (B) Peptide bond (C) Ketone group (D) Alcohol group
answer: Glycosidic bond (B) Peptide bond (C) Ketone group (D) Alcohol group
solution: A. A covalent bond is formed by sharing of electrons between the atoms. B. A glycosidic bond is a kind of covalent linkage by which two monosaccharides are joined together. Whenever a glycosidic bond is formed, there is the elimination of a water molecule similar to the formation of a peptide bond. These reactions are called dehydration or condensation reactions. C. A peptide bond is formed between the carboxyl group of one amino acid and the amino group of another amino acid. D. An ionic bond is formed due to electrostatic attraction between oppositely charged ions. So, the correct answer is 'Glycosidic bond'.

question: Which of the following is not a coenzyme?
question_latex: Which of the following is not a coenzyme?
solution: Coenzymes are loosely attached non-protein low molecular weight thermostable organic groups, which readily separate from the apoenzyme, \textit{e.g.}, NAD (Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide), NADP (Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide Phosphate), FAD, FMN, Co-A, TPP (Thiamine Pyrophosphate), lipoic acid, etc. ATP (Adenosine Triphosphate) is the common energy currency of all cells.

question: Select the false statement I. Living process is a constant effort to promote falling into equilibrium II. Energy can enter and leave a cell III. Matter can enter and leave a cell IV. Metabolic pathways are interlinked
question_latex: Select the false statement I. Living process is a constant effort to promote falling into equilibrium II. Energy can enter and leave a cell III. Matter can enter and leave a cell IV. Metabolic pathways are interlinked
solution: As living organisms work continuously, they cannot afford to reach equilibrium. Hence, the living state is a non-equilibrium steady-state to be able to perform work, living process is a constant effort to prevent falling into equilibrium
